main.name: Scott Harvey
main.description: I have over 15 years of experience with web development technologies such as JavaScript, Adobe ColdFusion, MS SQL Server, Oracle, HTML, and CSS. I am looking to apply these skills in a Full Stack Developer position working with the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js). I have been learning this stack over the last six months and will complete the Full Stack Developer boot camp at Hyperion Dev in September 2019.
main.bio:
I'm dry-humored and the most socialable introvert you will meet. For example, my partner and I have been to over 25 weddings together, and I've dragged her to the majority of them. I enjoy traveling and still find it amazing that I have been fortunate enough to travel to about 30 countries on 6 continents, most recently Nepal and Indonesia.

As a software engineer, I enjoy developing with ColdFusion, and I think it is a shame that Adobe hasn't done more to boost its profile. That said, I learned object-oriented programming while developing ColdFusion applications, and I would now like to use these and other skills while working with modern technologies.

Currently, I am attending a Full Stack Developer bootcamp using the MERN stack. It is nice to have more tools in my toolbox, and I'm looking forward to new opportunities to use them. While my bootcamp projects cover the full MERN stack, I have most enjoyed learning backend API development using Express.js and MongoDB. Additionally, I have appreciated the chance to update my front end development skills, adding Bootstrap and responsive CSS to my repertoire.

Professionally, I value a sense of ownership most of all. The position that I recall most fondly was at CLR where I built an intranet from the ground up. I was responsible for all aspects of the project â€” managing web hosting including database and web server setup, database architecture / design, and software development. As I automated CLR's processes, I felt great pride in developing software that fostered communication between employees and made work easier for them.

I enjoy a challenge and I believe that if you aren't in a little over your head, you will not grow. I'm looking for my next challenge.

skills.skillmessage: Here are some of the skills I've picked up along the way:

bootcampProjects.title: To-do List v2 (with Login)
bootcampProjects.overlayText: The ReactJS app 'To-Do v1' with an RESTful ExpressJS API back-end. Express uses Mongoose to interface with MongoDB in order to save to-do items.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Build upon the previous to-do application by adding a login and writing the to-do items to MongoDB.
bootcampProjects.solution:
Added an ExpressJS back-end to To-Do v1. Express serves as an RESTful API and it uses Mongoose to interface with MongoDB in order to save to-do items.

Used help from Build a Login/Auth App with the MERN Stack and How to take advantage of Local Storage in your React projects for authentication and session management.
bootcampProjects.technology: MERN (MongoDB (Mongoose), ExpressJS, ReactJS, NodeJS), React Bootstrap, and React Simple Storage

bootcampProjects.title: Cars v2
bootcampProjects.overlayText: A ReactJS app with an RESTful Express API for a simplified version of an inventory tracker for an automobile dealership.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Create a full stack web application that uses a MongoDB collection to store a collection about cars in an inventory. Create the back-end of the application using Express and the front-end using React.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used Express to build an RESTful API that serves as the back-end for a React front-end that is a simplified version of an inventory tracker for an automobile dealership. The API uses Mongoose to interface with MongoDB in order to save cars to the inventory. The React front-end was bootstrapped using create-react-app.
bootcampProjects.technology: MERN (MongoDB (Mongoose), ExpressJS, ReactJS, NodeJS)and React Bootstrap

bootcampProjects.title: Currency Converter / Three Card Monte
bootcampProjects.overlayText: A ReactJS app that allows the user to choose between a currency converter and a Three-card Monte game.
bootcampProjects.assignment:
Create an app that allows the user to choose between a currency converter and a Three-card Monte game.

Converter: The user should be able to enter a number of dollars, which the app calculates and displays in Rands, Pounds, and Euros. Components displaying converted values should be children of the conversion component.

Game: The user should be shown 3 â€˜Cardsâ€™. When clicked, they 'turn' to reveal a won or lost message. The player can then â€˜Try againâ€™ or â€˜Quitâ€™. The winning card should be different each time.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used create-react-app to bootstrap a ReactJS app. Exchange rates are fetched from https://apilayer.com/. The game fulfills requirements and notes winning or losing streaks.

features.feature: Custom feedback for winning / losing streaks

bootcampProjects.title: Current Weather
bootcampProjects.overlayText: A ReactJS app that displays the current weather in the city of the user's choice.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Create a ReactJS app that will display the weather in a city of the userâ€™s choice. The user should be able to enter or select the name of the city that they would like to see the weather for. The app should get the weather by fetching the OpenWeatherMap API
bootcampProjects.solution:
Used create-react-app to bootstrap a ReactJS app that displays the current weather in the city of the user's choice by fetching it from the OpenWeatherMap API.

The app adds the user's previous choices to a selector that triggers a fresh API call to the OpenWeatherMap API.

In order to improve on the assigned project I also used the Google Maps API to fetch and auto-suggest names of cities as the user types.

features.feature: Uses APIs to autosuggest cities and get weather

bootcampProjects.title: Connect Four
bootcampProjects.assignment: Create a simple game (other than Tic-Tac-Toe) using React.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used create-react-app to bootstrap a ReactJS game of Connect Four.

bootcampProjects.title: To-do List v1
bootcampProjects.solution: Used create-react-app to bootstrap a ReactJS to-do list that allows the user to add / delete items from a list and has admin users that can see other users' lists.

bootcampProjects.title: Using an API
bootcampProjects.overlayText: Used NextJS to fetch data from the Star Wars API and ReactJS to create a list / drilldown style app for Star Wars characters.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Use NextJS to build a dynamic website that uses data retrieved from an API.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used NextJS to fetch data from the Star Wars API and ReactJS to create a list / drilldown style app. The app displays 5 random character names that drill down to character details.

bootcampProjects.title: Calculator
bootcampProjects.solution: Used create-react-app to bootstrap a ReactJS calculator.

bootcampProjects.title: Guitarist Center v2
bootcampProjects.overlayText: Used a previous project for an online guitar store and added a functional shopping cart that meets the requirements.
bootcampProjects.assignment: Make an online store with a functional shopping cart and a checkout process that can accept a discount code.
bootcampProjects.solution: Used a previous project for an online guitar store and added a functional shopping cart that meets the requirements.
bootcampProjects.technology: sessionStorage for shopping cart persistence, Bootstrap 4, HTML, and JavaScript.

bootcampProjects.title: Guitarist Center v3
bootcampProjects.solution: Used create-react-app to bootstrap a ReactJS guitar store.
bootcampProjects.technology: localStorage for shopping cart persistence, ReactJS, React Bootstrap, jQuery, and jQueryUI

bootcampProjects.solution: Used bootstrap and HTML to create an ordering system for a restaurant.

bootcampProjects.solution: A simple page that shows various car models and shows the description of the car when clicked.
